description: The State Department approved the emergency sale of $138 million in air-defense equipment for Ukraine, part of a US push to keep up support for the country while a far larger assistance package remains stuck in Congress.
title: US Approves $138 Million in Air Defense Equipment for Ukraine

description: The White House summit Thursday between President Joe Biden, Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has one overriding goal: deepening US cooperation with two key allies on the front lines of tensions with China.
title: China Tensions At Center of Biden’s Summit With Kishida, Marcos

description: US Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack implied that China may be favoring Brazilian corn and soybeans partly in retaliation against recent restrictions on ownership of American farmland.
title: China’s Spurning of Farm Exports Has Retaliatory Aspect, US Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove previews the White House visit by Japan’s prime minister and one of the topics that won’t be up for discussion. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden and Kishida Ignore Elephant in the Room: The US Steel Deal

description: South Koreans went to polls to elect a new parliament in the only national referendum during President Yoon Suk Yeol’s term, which will determine how much power he will have for his remaining three years in office.
title: South Korea Votes for New Parliament in Referendum on President

description: El barómetro electoral de Bloomberg para las elecciones de México 2024 muestra que la candidata del partido gobernante, Claudia Sheinbaum, llevaba una ventaja de 25 puntos antes del primer debate televisado de este domingo. ¿Mantendrá su ventaja?
title: Elecciones México 2024: Sheinbaum lidera con 25pp a la espera de encuestas post debate

description: Bloomberg's poll tracker for the Mexico 2024 elections shows ruling party candidate Claudia Sheinbaum leading by 25 points. Will her lead hold?
title: Mexico Election 2024 Tracker: Sheinbaum Leads By 25 Points Before Post-Debate Polls

description: Investors fear a proposal that would allow Peruvians to tap their retirement savings could force pension funds to sell assets in order to make as much as $7 billion available for withdrawal.
title: Investors Brace for $7 Billion Pension Withdrawal Bill in Peru

description: The Pentagon revealed that its contract to deploy Elon Musk’s Starlink terminals in Ukraine is worth $23 million, finally putting a dollar figure on a deal that has embroiled the world’s richest man in the Russia conflict — sometimes to his own chagrin.
title: SpaceX Contract to Supply Starlink in Ukraine Is Worth $23 Million

description: Former Ecuador Vice President Jorge Glas, who days ago was forcibly removed from the Mexican Embassy, was returned to Guayaquil’s high-security La Roca penitentiary Tuesday after medical treatment, the nation’s prison service said.
title: Ecuador Ex-Vice President Jorge Glas Transferred Back to Prison

description: Venezuela detained former oil and finance ministers Tareck El Aissami and Simón Zerpa more than a year after an investigation into billions of lost Petroleos de Venezuela SA revenue that’s led to a purge of the ruling elite’s inner circle.
title: Venezuela Detains Former Maduro Confidantes in PDVSA Probe

description: An 1864 law that criminalized nearly all abortions in Arizona can take effect, the state’s top court said Tuesday.
title: Arizona Supreme Court Reinstates Near-Total Ban on Abortions

description: Former Colombian President Alvaro Uribe faces trial over an alleged conspiracy to bribe jailed criminals.
title: Uribe Charged Over Alleged Plot to Bribe Colombian Gangsters

description: After a decade of flush coffers, Washington is bracing for lower revenue as the downtown of the nation’s capital continues to struggle with a post-pandemic bounceback.
title: Washington DC’s Cash Bounty to Wither on Empty Offices, Downtown

description: Britain’s environment secretary rejected a direct appeal for help from the owners of Thames Water, underscoring the government’s efforts to stay out of the financial crisis rocking the UK’s largest water company.
title: UK Environment Chief Rebuffed Thames Water Owners’ Plea for Help

description: For years, the International Monetary Fund has collected billions of dollars in fees from its biggest borrowers, a practice that penalized those most in need. Now, with its coffers refilling and interest rates running high, the world’s lender of last resort is considering giving them a break.
title: IMF Faces Pressure to Cut Billions in Fees for Large Borrowers

description: The woman who stole the diary of President Joe Biden’s daughter Ashley and sold it to a conservative group before the 2020 election was sentenced to a month behind bars and three months of home detention.
title: Ashley Biden Diary Thief Gets Month in Jail Plus Home Detention

description: Elon Musk will meet Argentine President Javier Milei at Tesla Inc.’s factory in Austin on Saturday during a week-long trip abroad, the government announced Tuesday.
title: Musk to Meet Argentine President Milei at Tesla Factory

description: The UK government will keep on selling arms to Israel after reviewing advice from the nation’s lawyers, Foreign Secretary David Cameron said.
title: UK Position on Selling Arms to Israel Is Unchanged, Cameron Says

description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin warned that Ukraine’s recent attacks on Russian oil refineries risk impacting global energy markets and urged the country to focus on military targets instead.
title: US Slams Strikes on Russia Oil Refineries as Risk to Oil Markets

description: The US has sent a stash of Iranian munitions it captured from Houthi militants to Ukraine to help in its fight to repel Russia’s invasion, the US Central Command said.
title: US Sends Ukraine Iranian Weapons Captured From Houthi Militants

description: South Africa’s government and the European Union delegation to the country stressed the strength of their relationship and said that they were working on holding a bilateral summit.
title: South Africa, EU Say They’re Preparing Summit, Relations Strong

description: A bipartisan pair of senators introduced a bill aimed at better enforcing export controls that so far have failed to stem the flow of sensitive technology to US adversaries.
title: Senators Propose Plan to Stem Flow of US Tech to Adversaries

description: Iceland’s three-party coalition will continue to rule the north Atlantic nation, headed by new Prime Minister Bjarni Benediktsson, after his predecessor Katrin Jakobsdottir stepped down to run for president.
title: Iceland Picks Benediktsson as Premier in Coalition Reshuffle

description: The European Union moved closer to extending its tariff-free trade with Ukraine, while tightening rules on food imports to placate protesting farmers’ concerns about oversupply.
title: EU to Set Stricter Rules on Ukraine Tariff-Free Trade Extension

description: Former South African President Jacob Zuma won a court bid to overturn his disqualification from running for parliament in next month’s election on the newly formed uMkhonto weSizwe Party’s ticket.
title: South Africa Court Rules Zuma Can Run for Parliament in Election

description: For decades, the US has guaranteed freedom of navigation in Asia’s waters, patrolling the seas with a view to maintaining the principle that no sovereign state shall suffer interference from another. China is increasingly challenging that status quo, using its growing military power to press long-standing territorial claims. So Washington is moving to reshape its decades-old regional alliances to keep Beijing’s ambitions in check. The tensions are most visible around Taiwan and in the South Chin
title: Why US-China Tensions Are Growing in the South China Sea

description: Irish lawmakers voted Simon Harris to be the next prime minister three weeks after Leo Varadkar unexpectedly resigned. At 37, he’ll be Ireland’s youngest premier.
title: Irish Parliament Votes to Appoint Simon Harris Prime Minister

description: The European Union ramped up pressure on Chinese clean-tech investments potentially squeezing out its local suppliers amid EU efforts to transform the bloc into a green economy.
title: EU Ramps Up Pressure on China’s Green Tech With Wind Probe

description: Malaysia’s King Ibrahim Iskandar has advised the country’s leaders not to give “extreme views” on issues relating to race and religion, as he sought to put an end to tensions caused by the sale of socks bearing the word “Allah.”
title: Malaysia King Calls for Unity Ahead of Holidays Amid Socks Row

description: An Indian court has upheld the arrest of Delhi’s Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, a key leader in the opposition alliance fighting upcoming national polls against Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party.
title: India Court Rejects Delhi Chief Minister’s Plea Against Arrest

description: Ukrainian military intelligence was responsible for an attack on a Russian naval missile carrier in the Baltic Sea, according to an official familiar with the operation, underscoring Kyiv’s effort to strike Kremlin forces far from the front line.
title: Ukraine Says It’s Behind Blaze on Russian Warship in Baltic Sea

description: Italy’s debt pile is set to start rising again, according to a new government outlook that also insists the economy will achieve 2024 growth exceeding most forecasts.
title: Meloni Officials Sees Italy’s Debt Rising With Growth Holding Up

description: Shipments from Primorsk and Ust-Luga were down by one-fifth from the previous week
title: Russia’s Crude Exports Fall Back as Flows From the Baltic Shrink

description: Switzerland failed in its duty to protect its citizens from the ravages of climate change, the European Court of Human Rights said in a ruling that could have ramifications across the continent.
title: Swiss Failed Citizens on Climate Change, Human Rights Court Says

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The World Is Entering a New, Costly Arms Race

description: The arrest of a senior counter-intelligence official, alleged to have traded secrets for Kremlin cash, is upending Austrian politics ahead of national elections and cementing the nation’s reputation as a haven for spies.
title: Alleged Kremlin Double Agent Rattles Austria Ahead of Elections

description: India’s monthly goods and services tax collection is expected to expand at more than 7% on average in the new fiscal year on robust economic growth and more people paying taxes for what they consume, a top official from the Finance Ministry said.
title: India Official Sees Monthly GST Collection Jumping 7% on Average

description: The European Union’s economy chief said the bloc should create a central treasury that can finance common goods through the issuance of eurobonds, as the EU confronts massive spending demands to bolster its defense sector.
title: EU Needs Its Own Treasury to Issue Eurobonds, Economy Chief Says

description: US President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida plan to form a council on defense industries and allow shipyard workers in Japan to perform more maintenance work on US Navy ships as they look to shore up their military alliance, according to a senior administration official.
title: Biden, Kishida to Strengthen Defense Alliance With Eye on China

description: China is sending its highest-level delegation to North Korea in nearly five years for a trip starting Thursday that comes as Pyongyang has drawn closer to Russia.
title: China Sends Highest Ranking Official to Pyongyang in Five Years

description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius threw his weight behind calls for reform of rules that restrict new borrowing by the federal government to help fund a radical overhaul of the nation’s armed forces.
title: German Defense Chief Calls for Loosening of Debt Restrictions

description: The UK’s opposition Labour Party pledged to tighten its proposed crackdown on non-domiciled residents and expand tax-compliance investigations if it wins the general election expected this year.
title: Labour Vows ‘Tax Dodger’ Crackdown to Fill Hole in Fiscal Plan

description: British Foreign Secretary David Cameron flew to Florida to meet Donald Trump, as the UK tries to get the Republican presidential candidate’s allies in the House of Representatives to support further military aid for Ukraine.
title: Cameron Lobbies Trump to Break US Roadblocks to Ukraine Aid

description: Turkey announced restrictions on exports to Israel after the Jewish state opposed Turkish aid drops over the Gaza Strip and President Recep Tayyip Erdogan faced criticism for maintaining trade ties.
title: Turkey Limits Exports to Israel Amid Islamist Backlash On Gaza

description: Bulgarian President Rumen Radev appointed an interim cabinet to prepare the Balkan country for a snap election to take place in June, the sixth ballot in just over three years.
title: Bulgaria Appoints Interim Cabinet to Prepare for June Snap Vote

description: Thailand’s government unveiled a slew of new measures including cuts in property registration and transfer fees to revive the nation’s residential real estate market.
title: Thailand Approves New Measures to Boost Property Sector

description: Thailand’s parliament may convene a special session in the next two months to discuss a host of finance bills including the budget for next fiscal year as Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin looks to accelerate public spending to shore up Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy.
title: Thailand Plans Special Parliament Session to Quicken 2025 Budget

description: The US and its allies are just starting to come to terms with the vast increase in defense spending required to counterbalance the militaries of Russia and China.
title: G-7 Faces a $10 Trillion Reckoning as the World Races to Re-Arm

description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s cabinet approval slipped back to the lowest since he took office, days after he sought to turn the page on a funding scandal by punishing ruling party lawmakers.
title: Japan PM’s Bid to Clear Scandal Fails to Improve Poll Support

description: Australia has hosed down speculation Japan may be formally invited to join the Aukus security partnership, saying Tokyo’s involvement would be limited to cooperation on developing advanced technologies.
title: Japan Won’t Be Invited to Formally Join Aukus, Australia PM Says

description: Pakistan’s new finance minister is on a mission to fix his country. To many, it’s an unenviable task.
title: With No Pay, Pakistan’s Finance Minister Leaves Banker Life Behind to Fix Economy
